I would Love to see my mountain base slowly accumulate, I also think there should be a gamerule to set it off and on. Thanks for reading this, Let Minecraft accumulate in love!

It's been a feature that I was wondering would ever get add, since I learned that you could get layered snow back in 2011.

They've had a snow level data value for Java MC snow since beta, but never implemented the snow accumulation feature.
this would be fantastic for superflat survival
yes please!

The reach in Bedrock edition and mobile edition is the same because it's the same base game. It just plays differently on mobile because is harder to handle.

 

Sadly a new combat update is going to come probably to bedrock edition, and it will be even harder for mobile to play it.
This is a real problem, anyone on pc can beat everyone else.. This is a real issue‚Ä¶
I play on console on cubecraft ffa and i swear the pc players have more hit range than console players

I agree! This also gives a good reason for villagers to have beds, not just some requirement. I also accidentally hit villagers, but in Bedrock it's much less stressful as villagers heal upon waking up. I hope this gets added to Java.
don't segregate the bedrock users we need this too
agree

This is such an obvious feature to have; Bedrock added convenient villager healing (through both beds and bread) with Village & Pillage in 2019, and it's silly that Java doesn't have it yet.

Currently, there is no way to heal a max-level villager other than splash potions, and there is no way to tell in the first place that they are at low health.  On my personal server, my friend's villager died of repeated 4-block falls.  There is no good-game-design reason for these things, and the obvious intuitive solution is right there in Bedrock ready to be ported over.

Agreed and as another commenter mentioned, it seems villagers are reportedly able to heal with bread as well on Bedrock edition. Both the bed and bread healing seems like it would be a really nice addition.

Loyalty tridents even immediately start to return upon hitting an entity on Console Edition and sadly Xbox One Edition and Nintendo Switch Edition do not have the aquatic update. It really frustrates me how loyalty tridents take way longer to return on bedrock because of this. Either fix this parity issue on bedrock or release the aquatic update to Xbox One Edition and Nintendo Switch Edition too, so that players on these platforms can enjoy this features too because they do not have it on bedrock.
I came here to post this exact request but you beat me to it! Please devs, add this feature to java!
This color is impossible to create in Bedrock
take a cauldron and then put water inside and then the same dyes that you would use on java press the cauldron with each dye and then bam!
Read the description. Whichever dye you put in last would overpower the others.
You should still be able to use the cauldron method, but also be able to use the crafting method like in Java and Legacy Console.

Legacy Console is the only edition where you can both use the cauldron method and the crafting method to dye leather armor. Both methods should be added to both Java and Bedrock. https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360047833872--Bedrock-Parity-Dyable-Cauldrons-More

With the new wolf armor I realized that dye options on Bedrock are limited compared to java. While the cauldron method may seem easier and more immersive it also restricts player creativity. Opening both dye avenues would be the solution that provides the most options for players to "shape their world".
Wait, they don't have shooting sounds? If that's the case, that might be why I keep getting hit by skeletons way more than in java.
Came here just to post this as I didn't realise this when making a tree farm on Bedrock.

At first glance, I thought this would be cool and I'm still in favor of it. But it's also a) kinda creepy for stalker types, and b) websites that show where you've been playing, such as https://minecraft-statistic.net/en/player/RomaqRosher.html

This could be a serious violation of privacy, especially someone watching for what server a given child might be playing.
Use vivecraft

If you have a headset such as the HTC Vive, Oculus Rift, or Valve Index, the ViveCraft mod for Minecraft java is you BEST BET. 

If you have a device like the Oculus Go or Gear VR, you dreams end here, as a mere phone cannot proccess a java client of minecraft, not well enough for vr, at least.

You see, when processing vr, your device needs to process 2 images in order to create a 3d effect. A phone cannot do such, but a computer powered vr headset can.
Everyone says they use Vivecraft, but they don't know that the most popular servers have blocked it
While we‚Äôre at it, can we add the Java Edition patterns to Bedrock? Voted.
Java can already use these patterns on a banner without the extra crafting step. Not really sure what the point of these are.

I believe that this should apply to all mobile devices. Currently, mobile can't use this quality of life feature present on all other Minecraft platforms! This pick block button could probably be at the top of the screen (near the pause/chat buttons) or at the bottom (near the hotbar). My suggestion to how it should work is that it puts you in a pick block mode where the next block you tap (or with the crosshair) will be pick blocked to your hand, and then it will turn off pick block mode until you tap the button again. This is to avoid the use of any confusing touch screen gestures.
They should implement it. Even a simple button at the top corners of the screen would be helpful. Redstone is such a pain without it.

The sneak button is useless until and unless tapped 2 times so if we hold the sneak button and tap on a block it could pick up the block and when we release the sneak button it will turn of the pick block mode. This feature would be LOVELY if added in mcpe
Why don't we still have this .. just one button that will improve QoL by a lot
Maybe a new button on the right/left, if you press 1x it normal pick block. 2x press for control pick block.
As someone who is keyboard illiterate I agree
yeah i need controller on java so much rn fr
